title: nightly panic: `index out of bounds: the len is 533 but the index is 533`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
# Meta
```
$ rustc +nightly --version --verbose
rustc 1.33.0-nightly (60e825389 2018-12-28)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 60e825389db3cb7421afb7015b28cb9436c79bba
commit-date: 2018-12-28
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.33.0-nightly
LLVM version: 8.0
```

# Code Sample
## `cargo.toml`
```
[package]
name = "bug"

[dependencies]
```
## `src/main.rs`
```rust
trait Scan<T> {
    fn scan(&mut self) -> Option<T>;
}
impl<'a, T> Scan<T> for Iterator<Item=T> {
    fn scan(&mut self) -> Option<T> {
        self.next()
    }
}
fn wrap_scanner<'a, T>(s: &'a mut Scan<T>) -> (impl FnMut() -> Option<T> + 'a) {
    move || { s.scan() }
}
fn main() {
    let scanner = &mut wrap_scanner(&mut "buggy".chars() as &mut Iterator<Item=char>);
}
```

# Compiler flags
```
RUST_BACKTRACE=full cargo +nightly run --verbose
```
